title-part.text: ELECTRONIC TIME-PIECES

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers: electronic time-pieces with no moving parts;electronic circuitry for producing timing pulses irrespective of the nature of the time indicating means utilised.
This subclass does not cover electronic time-pieces with moving parts, which are covered by subclass G04C.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Producing timing pulses

reference.text: driving circuits for stepping motors G04C3/14; producing preselected time intervals for use as timing standards G04F5/00; pulse technique in general H03K; control, synchronisation, or stabilisation of generators in general H03L

title-part.text: Circuits for deriving low frequency timing pulses from pulses of higher frequency

reference.text: pulse frequency dividers in general H03K23/00 - H03K29/00

CPC-specific-text.text: the desired number of pulses per unit of time being obtained by adding to or substracting from a pulse train one or more pulses

reference.text: in general G06F7/68

CPC-specific-text.text: by storing time-date which are periodically investigated and modified accordingly, e.g. by using cyclic shift-registers
by combining pulse-trains of different frequencies, e.g. obtained from two independent oscillators or from a common oscillator by means of different frequency dividing ratios

reference.text: sychronisation of electric time pieces G04G7/00, G04C11/00

title-part.text: Temperature-compensating arrangements
Setting, i.e. correcting or changing, the time-indication

reference.text: radio-controlled time-pieces G04R

CPC-specific-text.text: brought into action by radio
Debouncing circuits
by using a separate register into which the entire correct setting is introduced, which is thereafter transferred to the time counters

title-part.text: by temporarily changing the number of pulses per unit time, e.g. quick-feed method

CPC-specific-text.text: quick-feed method
the time-counters first being reset to zero
by adding or suppressing individual pulses, e.g. for step-motor

title-part.text: by setting each of the displayed values, e.g. date, hour, independently

CPC-specific-text.text: Correction of the minutes counter in function of the seconds' counter position at zero adjustment of the latter
using commutating devices for selecting the value, e.g. hours, minutes, seconds, to be corrected
using a sequential electronic commutator
by using a separate register into which the correct setting of one of the counters is introduced which is thereafter transferred to the selected time-counter to be reset
by using a separate register into which the correct setting of the selected time-counter is introduced which is thereafter transferred to the time-counter to be reset

CPC-specific-text.text: by radio
provided with arrangements to prevent synchronisation by interfering signals
the time-piece preparing itself on set times on the reception of the synchronising signal

by light valves in general

by controlling light sources, e.g. electroluminescent diodes
